column1: Trewsday (archaic form Trewesdei) was the fourth day of the week in the Shire Calendar. It represented the Númenórean day Orgaladh
column2: originally dedicated to the tree Nimloth of Númenor.

column1: After the reform of Isengrim Took II
column2: dates such as 1 February and 1 August always fell on Trewsday.

column1: Trewsday represents an archaic Hobbitish form "Trewesdei"
column2: a word preserved in the Yellowskin.

column1: Trewsday is translated as "Tuesday " in The Lord of the Rings.
